name: Tempelhofer Feld (dog areas)
description: Former airport turned park with zoned off-leash areas and long runways for walks; dogs must be leashed in some zones and during bird breeding season.

name: Grunewaldsee Hundestrand (Dog beach)
description: Forest lake with very popular dog beach; huge adjacent off-leash area in Grunewald forest.

name: Grunewald Forest Trails
description: Extensive forest network with signed trails; popular with dog walkers. Keep dogs under control and observe posted rules.

name: Café am Neuen See
description: Beer garden and restaurant by the lake in Tiergarten; dogs commonly welcomed on terrace.

name: Fressnapf Berlin-Kreuzberg
description: Large chain pet store for food, accessories and supplies.

name: Veterinärmedizinisches Zentrum Berlin – Tierarztpraxis Rödiger (24h)
description: 24/7 small animal hospital with emergency services.

name: Martin Rütter Hundeschule Berlin (Inh. Sandau)
description: Well-known dog training school offering group and individual sessions.

name: Platja de Llevant – Àrea per a gossos (Dog Beach)
description: Seasonal dog beach section with fenced area and water access.

name: Parc de la Ciutadella (designated areas)
description: Historic city park; dogs allowed on-leash; check signage for any off-leash or fenced zones.

name: Carretera de les Aigües (Collserola)
description: Iconic ridge path in Collserola Natural Park with panoramic city views; dogs must be on leash per park regulations.

name: Corgi Café (Gòtic)
address: Pl. de la Vila de Madrid, 4, 08002 Barcelona
description: Dog-themed brunch café; pet-friendly vibe.

name: Kiwoko – Diagonal Mar
description: Large pet store with accessories and services.

name: SURvet – Urgencias Veterinarias 24h
description: 24/7 emergency veterinary hospital and referral center.

name: Hotel Caní El Vilà (near Barcelona)
address: Veïnat de Vilà, s/n, 08460 Sant Esteve de Palautordera (Barcelona)
description: Dog hotel with play areas and a beach‑style pool; 24h surveillance.

name: Villa Doria Pamphilj – Area Cani
address: Via di S. Pancrazio, 10, 00152 Roma RM
description: Largest landscaped park in Rome with designated dog areas (‘area cani’).

name: Parco degli Acquedotti
description: Scenic archaeological park with broad trails along ancient aqueducts; popular for walking dogs on leash.

name: DK Dog Sports – Centro acquatico cinofilo (pool)
description: Canine aquatic center with pool and dog-sport activities; supervised swimming (not a natural lake).

name: Bar Locarno (pet-friendly)
description: Historic cocktail bar and café; dogs allowed (outdoor seating).

name: Family Dog Club (Asilo per cani)
description: Dog daycare and boarding services in Rome (Tuscolana).

name: Bois de Boulogne (dogs allowed on paths)
description: Vast urban woodland; dogs generally allowed on main paths on leash; specific lawns restricted.

name: Bois de Vincennes (dogs allowed on paths)
description: Large park east of Paris; dogs allowed on paths on leash; check signage for restrictions.

name: Café de Flore
description: Iconic Left Bank café; terrace frequently hosts patrons with dogs (leash and etiquette required).

name: Angelina Paris (Rivoli)
description: Historic tea room; terrace sometimes accommodates dogs; check staff guidance.

name: Moustaches – Marais (Archives)
description: Trendy urban pet boutique for dogs and cats; multiple city locations.

name: CHV Frégis (24h Emergency)
description: 24/7 veterinary hospital serving Paris region.

name: Nina Dalle – Toilettage Spa
description: Dog grooming spa services in Paris.

name: Pension du Pont de Sèvres (near Paris)
description: Family-run dog and cat boarding 5 minutes from Paris.
